result.execSummary:
The defendant Corene L Sells was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: with JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached

Case called at 10:49 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Corene L Sells in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No possession of controlled substances without valid prescription
--No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent, with exception for father of her child John Balisteri
--To pay statutory costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--Repayment of Attorney fees

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 11:30 am
from Defense Counsel re: Sentencing (with enclosed ref. letters in support of Defendant)
FINANCIAL NOTES:  $375.00 Attorney fee paid via gps @ counter

Case called at 10:40 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Corene L Sells in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Rhiel: Do not have agreement, but are request matter be set for plea/sentencing and make own recommendation for sentencing
ADA Beck: Agreed
Court addresses Attorney fee payments with Miss Sells; Miss Sells informs the Court that she was unsure where to make payments
Court clarifies with Miss Sells the Atty fee payment order - She indicates that she can catch up with the payments today
Court reminds Miss Sells that her bond/conditions of release remain in effect while the case is pending
Recess: 10:43 am 

NEXT:  (1) Schedule Plea/Sentencing Hearing 10/15/15 at 10:45 am - Send notices

DA Happ: No objection
Court confirms address on file is accurate for Miss Sells
